Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Angolan President 
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, received credentials from Carlos Frota, new Portuguese ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly
Hall today.
 Present there was Kung Sok Ung, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs.    
 Kim conversed with the ambassador after receiving the credentials.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from New Portuguese Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Receives Credentials from New Portuguese Ambassador
    Pyongyang, November 10 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Jose Eduardo Dos Santos, president of Angola, on the occasion of the 29th anniversary of its independence.
 Kim in the message wished the president and people of Angola greater success in their work for the national unity and the lasting peace and development of the country and expressed the conviction that the ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to grow stronger in the mutual interests.
